ai-ja436:1.1_0: “Where, sirs, do those three people come from?
ai-ja436:1.2_0: and sit down on the seat spread out.
ai-ja436:1.3_0: Do you, good sirs, have this wholesome root
ai-ja436:2.2_0: But no secondone can carry me around.
ai-ja436:3.3_0: Since they’ve arrived, they are always caught up in them.
ai-ja436:3.4_0: on account of a one or your son.”
ai-ja436:4.3_0: Having seen the danger in ( charnel ground)
ai-ja436:4.4_0: Cold him to his son with a son.”
ai-ja436:5.1_0: “Having seen the noble ones holding on top of the formless,
ai-ja436:5.4_0: he rejoiced in heaven for me.
ai-ja436:6.1_0: day and night: I have attended to you,
ai-ja436:6.2_0: A Tapodāka’s rolling in the Jeta Grove,
ai-ja436:6.3_0: What was reckoned to immoral Dhamma
ai-ja436:7.1_0: I’m stumbled and falling with you.
ai-ja436:7.3_0: What was reckoned to immoral Dhamma
ai-ja436:8.1_0: How is it that I’m ever to learn?
ai-ja436:8.2_0: not for those with minds, and doesn’t protect the minds of elephants,
ai-ja436:9.1_0: “These are those who have no loved ones at all,
ai-ja436:9.2_0: and those who were captivated by a woman.
